class.name: CameraFeed
class.brief_description: A camera feed gives you access to a single physical camera attached to your device.
class.description: A camera feed gives you access to a single physical camera attached to your device. When enabled, Godot will start capturing frames from the camera which can then be used. See also [CameraServer]. [b]Note:[/b] Many cameras will return YCbCr images which are split into two textures and need to be combined in a shader. Godot does this automatically for you if you set the environment to show the camera image in the background. [b]Note:[/b] This class is currently only implemented on Linux, Android, Web, macOS, and iOS. On other platforms no [CameraFeed]s will be available. To get a [CameraFeed] on iOS, the camera plugin from [url=https://github.com/godotengine/godot-ios-plugins]godot-ios-plugins[/url] is required.

method.name: _activate_feed
method.description: Called when the camera feed is activated.

method.name: _deactivate_feed
method.description: Called when the camera feed is deactivated.

method.name: get_id
method.description: Returns the unique ID for this feed.

method.name: get_position
method.description: Returns the position of camera on the device.

method.name: get_texture_tex_id
method.description: Returns the texture backend ID (usable by some external libraries that need a handle to a texture to write data).

method.name: set_external
method.description: Sets the feed as external feed provided by another library.

method.name: set_format
set_position
method.description: Sets the position of this camera.

method.name: set_rgb_image
method.description: Sets RGB image for this feed.

method.name: set_ycbcr_image
method.description: Sets YCbCr image for this feed.

method.name: set_ycbcr_images
method.description: Sets Y and CbCr images for this feed.

members.member: The transform applied to the camera's image.
Formats supported by the feed. Each entry is a [Dictionary] describing format parameters.

signal.name: format_changed
signal.description: Emitted when the format has changed.

signal.name: frame_changed
signal.description: Emitted when a new frame is available.

constants.constant: No image set for the feed.
Feed supplies YCbCr images that need to be converted to RGB.
Feed supplies separate Y and CbCr images that need to be combined and converted to RGB.
Camera is mounted at the front of the device.
Camera is mounted at the back of the device.
